revised_title: Inflammation of Connective Tissue: Observations on Corneal Inflammation
tldr: The author examines the effects of inflammation on connective tissue, specifically the cornea, using various staining techniques and methods. They observe changes in the structure and behavior of cells, such as the spindle cells, stellate cells, and flat cells, during inflammation. The study provides insights into the cellular and histological changes that occur during corneal inflammation and the role of different cell types in the process.
